ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a basic overview of lab techniques that can be applicable to archaeology, and I learned how to conduct my own unique research using one of these techniques, and how to present a conference-style poster about my findings.

Gained an understanding of the lab techniques employed in archaeology, the history behind them and lots of hands-on exposure (including great guest lecturers and trips) to them. Developed my own interests in archaeology through an independent final project.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course does a good job providing an overview of techniques, but I found that the quality of coverage varied depending on who was giving the lecture of the day. I think that this course presents an amazing and unique opportunity to do research as part of a course, but I think that there are limitations on the techniques that are feasible, and this results in lots of people using the same basic technique.

Strengths were the teaching style, small class, teachers' knowledge, the flexibility of the class in allowing us to undertake our own project, guest lecturers and field trips. Weaknesses were very few and far between, can't even think of one.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I think it is a decent overview course, and is required for archaeological studies majors; however, I think that there are probably better and more interesting courses if you do not need to take it.

I would 100% recommend this course for anyone interested in Archaeology or just exploring how we test things. Great instructors, great content, great guest lectures and field trips (to West Campus), this course is well-rounded and complements any degree perfectly. Also the independent aspect of the final is good preparation for senior projects. Outstanding course.... take it!
